poem:
**Politics Unveiled**

Vile whispers in digital halls,  
hidden truths, like shadows, crawl.  
A cycling dreamer's fate unseen,  
mocked, aghast—what does it mean?  

Words like daggers, sharp and cold,  
echo stories seldom told.  
In fragments of a glowing screen,  
conscience falters, heartless sheen.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Labour was told about ‘vile’ WhatsApp group more than a year ago, says ex-councillor Labour was warned more than a year ago about a “vile” WhatsApp group involving two of the party’s MPs, local councillors and a series of offensive messages, the Guardian has been told. It came as a cycling campaigner said he was “profoundly distressed” to learn that one of the MPs, Andrew Gwynne, joked about him being “mown down” by a lorry.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
